When a picture-string contains a repeated sequence of symbols — PIC 9999/99/99 — for example, the repetition can be specified using a parenthetic repeat count, as in PIC 9(4)/9(2)/9(2). Using repeat counts is optional and their use (or not) is entirely at the discretion of the programmer. Many programmers use repetition for small sequences (PIC XXX) and repeat counts for larger ones (PIC 9(9).

trans-unit.source: When a Format 1 REPLACE statement with the ALSO keyword is encountered without Replace Mode being currently active, the effect will be as if the ALSO had not been specified. If Replace Mode already was in effect, the effect will be to “push” the current change specification(s) onto the top of a stack and add the specification(s) of the new statement to those that were already in effect.

When a Format 1 REPLACE without the ALSO keyword is encountered, any stacked change specification(s), if any, will be discarded and the currently in-effect change specification(s), if any, will be replaced by those of the new statement.

trans-unit.source: When a GnuCOBOL program is executed from a command-line, the complete command line text will be broken into a series of

When a GnuCOBOL program is executed from a command-line, the complete command line text will be broken into a series of "tokens", where each token is identified as being a word separated from the others in the command text by at least one space. For example, if the command line was /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST, there will be five tokens identified by the operating system — "/usr/local/myprog", "THIS", "IS", "A" and "TEST".
trans-unit.target: Когда программа GnuCOBOL выполняется из командной строки, весь текст командной строки будет разбит на серию «токенов», где каждый токен идентифицируется как слово, отделенное от других в тексте команды хотя бы одним пробелом. , Например, если в командной строке было указано /usr/local/myprog THIS IS A TEST , будет пять токенов, идентифицированных операционной системой - «/ usr / local / myprog», «ЭТО», «ЕСТЬ», «А». и «ТЕСТ».

trans-unit.source: When an input procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on the INPUT PROCEDURE clause will be invoked as if by a procedural PERFORM statement (see Procedural PERFORM) with no VARYING, TIMES or UNTIL options specified. Records will be loaded into the sort work file — one at a time — within the input procedure using the RELEASE statement (see RELEASE). This, by the way, is how you could sort the contents of relative or indexed files.

trans-unit.target: Когда используется процедура ввода, процедуры, указанные в INPUT PROCEDURE

trans-unit.source: When an output procedure is used, the procedure(s) specified on the OUTPUT PROCEDURE clause will be invoked as if by a procedural PERFORM statement (see Procedural PERFORM) with no VARYING, TIMES or UNTIL options specified. Records will be retrieved from the sort work file — one at a time — within the output procedure using the RETURN statement (see RETURN).

Merged records may be read from the merge work file — one at a time — within the output procedure using the RETURN (see RETURN) statement.

trans-unit.source: When comparing one numeric value to another, the USAGE (see USAGE) and number of significant digits in either value are irrelevant as the comparison is performed using the actual algebraic values.
When comparing one numeric value to another, theUSAGE(see USAGE) and number of significant digits in either value are irrelevant as the comparison is performed using the actual algebraic values.

trans-unit.source: When comparing strings, the comparison is made based upon the program’s collating sequence. When the two string arguments are of unequal length, the shorter is assumed to be padded (on the right) with a sufficient number of spaces as to make the two strings of equal length. String comparisons take place on a corresponding character-by-character basis, left to right, until the TRUE/FALSE value for the relation test can be established. Characters are compared according to their relative position in the program’s COLLATING SEQUENCE (as defined in SPECIAL-NAMES (see SPECIAL-NAMES)),

When comparing strings, the comparison is made based upon the program’s collating sequence. When the two string arguments are of unequal length, the shorter is assumed to be padded (on the right) with a sufficient number of spaces as to make the two strings of equal length. String comparisons take place on a corresponding character-by-character basis, left to right, until the TRUE/FALSE value for the relation test can be established. Characters are compared according to their relative position in the program’sCOLLATING SEQUENCE(as defined inSPECIAL-NAMES(see SPECIAL-NAMES)),

Когда два строковых аргумента имеют неравную длину, предполагается, что более короткий будет дополнен (справа) достаточным количеством пробелов, чтобы сделать две строки одинаковой длины. Сравнение строк происходит на соответствующей посимвольной основе, слева направо, пока не будет установлено значение ИСТИНА / ЛОЖЬ для проверки связи. Символы сравниваются в соответствии с их относительным положением в COLLATING SEQUENCE программы (как определено в SPECIAL-NAMES (см. СПЕЦИАЛЬНЫЕ ИМЕНА )),

trans-unit.source: When describing a report via the RD (see REPORT SECTION) clause, the total number of usable lines are specified as the PAGE LIMIT value; this value is the sum of the number of lines contained in the Heading, Body and Footing Areas.

trans-unit.source: When group items are being defined, subordinate items may be assigned the “name” FILLER. There may be any number of FILLER items defined within a group item. A data item named FILLER cannot be referenced directly; these items are generally used to specify an unused portion of the total storage allocated to a group item. Note that it is possible that the name of the group item itself might be specified as FILLER if there is no need to ever refer directly to the group structure itself.

When making an attribute change to <var>identifier-1</var>, the change will not become visible on the screen until the screen section data item containing <var>identifier-1</var> is next accepted (if <var>identifier-1</var> is an input field) or is next displayed (if <var>identifier-1</var> is not an input field).

trans-unit.source: When multiple programs occur in a source file, it is assumed that the programs are related to one another in that they will be CALLed or executed as functions from the others.
When multiple programs occur in a source file, it is assumed that the programs are related to one another in that they will be CALLed or executed as functions from the others.

trans-unit.source: When only a portion of a reserved word is underlined, it indicates that the word may either be coded in its full form or may be abbreviated to the portion that is underlined.
trans-unit.target: Когда подчеркнута только часть зарезервированного слова,это указывает на то,что слово может быть либо полностью закодировано,либо сокращено до части,которая подчеркнута.

When programs get very large, it becomes more and more challenging to keep track of the data items that will be used in the program. Here, in no particular order of importance, are a variety of conventions that can simply that problem.
trans-unit.target: Когда программы становятся очень большими,становится все сложнее отслеживать элементы данных,которые будут использоваться в программе.Здесь,не в особом порядке важности,существуют различные конвенции,которые могут просто решить эту проблему.

trans-unit.source: When reading a LINE SEQUENTIAL file, records in excess of the size implied by the file’s description in the FILE SECTION will be truncated while records shorter than that size will be padded to the right with SPACES.

When reading aLINE SEQUENTIALfile, records in excess of the size implied by the file’s description in theFILE SECTIONwill be truncated while records shorter than that size will be padded to the right withSPACES
trans-unit.target: При чтении файла LINE SEQUENTIAL записи, размер которых превышает размер, подразумеваемый описанием файла в FILE SECTION , будут усечены, а записи короче этого размера будут дополнены справа SPACES

trans-unit.source: When reading any sequential (any organization) or relative file, the "next" direction refers to the physical sequence of records in the file. When reading an indexed file, the "next" and "previous" directions refer to the sequence of primary or alternate record key values in the file’s records, regardless of where the records physically occur within the file.
trans-unit.target: При чтении любого последовательного (любой организации) или относительного файла «следующее» направление относится к физической последовательности записей в файле. При чтении индексированного файла направления «следующий» и «предыдущий» относятся к последовательности значений ключа первичной или альтернативной записи в записях файла, независимо от того, где эти записи физически находятся в файле.

trans-unit.source: When reading any sequential (any organization) or relative file, the “next” direction refers to the physical sequence of records in the file. When reading an indexed file, the “next” and “previous” directions refer to the sequence of primary or alternate record key values in the file’s records, regardless of where the records physically occur within the file.

When reserved words appear without underlining, as this one is, they are optional; such reserved words are available in the language syntax merely to improve readability — their presence or absence has no effect upon the program.
trans-unit.target: Когда зарезервированные слова появляются без подчеркивания, как это, они необязательны; такие зарезервированные слова доступны в синтаксисе языка просто для улучшения читабельности - их наличие или отсутствие не влияет на программу.

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with

When searching a table with "n" entries, a binary search will need a worst-case of log2(n) tests in order to find an entry and log2(n) tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist (n = the number of entries in the table), where "log2" is the base-2 logarithm function.
trans-unit.target: При поиске в таблице с «n» записями для двоичного поиска потребуется наихудший вариант тестов log2 (n), чтобы найти запись, и тестов log2 (n), чтобы определить, что запись не существует (n = количество записей в таблице), где "log2" - функция логарифма по основанию 2.

trans-unit.source: When searching a table with "n" entries, a sequential search will need an average of n/2 tests and a worst case of n tests in order to find an entry and n tests to identify that an entry doesn’t exist.
trans-unit.target: При поиске в таблице с «n» записями для последовательного поиска потребуется в среднем n / 2 тестов и наихудший случай из n тестов, чтобы найти запись, и n тестов, чтобы определить, что запись не существует.

trans-unit.source: When single record locking is in effect, as a new record is accessed, locks held for previous records are released. By using this option, not only is the newly accessed record locked (as WITH LOCK would do), but prior record locks will be retained as well. A subsequent READ without the KEPT LOCK option will release all “kept” locks, as will the UNLOCK statement.

When single record locking is in-effect, as a new record is accessed, locks held for previous records are released. By using this option, not only is the newly-accessed record locked (as WITH LOCK would do), but prior record locks will be retained as well. A subsequentREADwithout theKEPT LOCKoption will release all "kept" locks, as will theUNLOCKstatement.
trans-unit.target: Когда действует блокировка отдельной записи, при доступе к новой записи блокировки, удерживаемые для предыдущих записей, снимаются. При использовании этой опции блокируется не только новая запись, к которой был получен доступ (как это было бы с WITH LOCK), но и предыдущие блокировки записи также сохраняются. Последующее READ без опции KEPT LOCK снимет все "сохраненные" блокировки, как и оператор UNLOCK .

When the expression-1 CHARACTERS option is used, INITIALIZED will initialize the allocated memory block to binary zeros. If INITIALIZED is not used, the initial contents of allocated memory will be left to whatever rules of memory allocation are in effect for the operating system the program is running under.

When the ALLOCATE statement (see ALLOCATE) statement is used to allocate a data item or to simply allocate an area of storage of a size specified on the ALLOCATE, that allocation may occur with or without initialization, as per the programmer’s needs.
When the ENTRY statement (see ENTRY) is being used.
When the Enter key is pressed.
When the LOCALE keyword is not specified, the returning value is negative if string contains CR, DB, or a minus sign.

When the LOCALE keyword is specified, the returned value is negative if string contains a negative sign and when not specified, the returning value is negative if string contains CR, DB, or a minus sign.
When the LOCALE keyword is specified, the returned value is negative if string contains a negative sign.
When the PERFORM begins execution, the FROM value will be moved to identifier.

When the identifier-1 option is used in conjunction with INITIALIZED (or its internationalized alternative INITIALISED), the allocated memory block will be initialized as if an INITIALIZE identifier-1 WITH FILLER ALL TO VALUE THEN TO DEFAULT (see INITIALIZE) were executed.

When the character set in use is ASCII with no collating sequence modifications, the LOW-VALUES figurative constant value is the ASCII NUL character. Because character sets can be redefined, however, you should not rely on this fact. Use the NULL figurative constant instead.

When the character set in use is ASCII with no collating sequence modifications, theLOW-VALUESfigurative constant value is the ASCII "NUL" character. Because character sets can be redefined, however, you should not rely on this fact — use theNULLfigurative constant instead.
trans-unit.target: Когда используется набор символов ASCII без каких-либо модификаций последовательности упорядочивания, значение образной константы LOW-VALUES является символом ASCII "NUL". Однако, поскольку наборы символов могут быть переопределены, вы не должны полагаться на этот факт - вместо этого используйте фигуративную константу NULL .

trans-unit.source: When the compiler is operating in Fixed Format Mode, all CDF statements must begin in column eight (8) or beyond.
trans-unit.target: Когда компилятор работает в режиме "Исправленный формат",все CDF-операторы должны начинаться с восьмого столбца (8)или далее.

trans-unit.source: When the console is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the window in which the program is executing, in terms of horizontal (COLUMNS) or vertical (LINES) character counts — not pixels.

When the console is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the window in which the program is executing, in terms of horizontal COLUMNS or vertical LINES character counts — not pixels.
trans-unit.target: Когда консоль работает в оконной среде, это будет размер окна, в котором выполняется программа, с точки зрения количества символов в горизонтальных COLUMNS или вертикальных LINES ,а не в пикселях.

trans-unit.source: When the end of the currently-compiling source file is reached, Replace Mode is deactivated and any stacked replace specifications will be discarded — compilation of the next source file (if any) will begin with Replace Mode inactive and no change specification(s) on the stack.
trans-unit.target: Когда достигается конец компилируемого в данный момент исходного файла, режим замены деактивируется, и все составные спецификации замены будут отброшены - компиляция следующего исходного файла (если есть) начнется с неактивным режимом замены и без изменений спецификации (й) на стек.

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the GnuCOBOL runtime system will strip the trailing delimiter sequence from each record. The data will be padded (on the right) with spaces if the data just read is shorter than the area described for data records in the program. If the data is too long, it will be truncated and the excess will be lost.
trans-unit.target: При считывании файла система времени выполнения GnuCOBOL удаляет последовательность трейлинговых разделителей из каждой записи.Данные будут заполнены (справа)пробелами,если только что прочитанные данные короче,чем область,описанная для записей данных в программе.Если данные слишком длинные,они будут усечены,а избыток потерян.

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file.
trans-unit.target: При считывании файла данные передаются в программу именно в том виде,в котором они существуют в файле.

trans-unit.source: When the file is read, the data is transferred into the program exactly as it exists in the file. In the event that a short record is read as the very last record, that record will be padded (to the right) with spaces.
trans-unit.target: При считывании файла данные передаются в программу именно в том виде,в котором они существуют в файле.В случае,если короткая запись считывается как самая последняя,эта запись будет дополнена (справа)пробелами.

trans-unit.source: When the file is written by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data, but a record-length field is added to the beginning of each physical record.
trans-unit.target: При записи файла программой GnuCOBOL к данным не добавляется разделительная последовательность,а к началу каждой физической записи добавляется поле длины записи.

trans-unit.source: When the system is running in a windowed environment, this will be the sizing of the console window in which the program is executing. When the system is not running a windowing environment, the physical console screen attributes will be returned. In environments such as a Windows console window, where the logical size of the window may far exceed that of the physical console window, the size returned will be that of the physical console window. Two one-byte values will be returned — the first will be the current number of lines (rows) while the second will be the number of columns.
trans-unit.target: Когда система работает в оконной среде, это будет размер окна консоли, в котором выполняется программа. Когда в системе не запущена оконная среда, будут возвращены атрибуты экрана физической консоли. В таких средах, как окно консоли Windows, где логический размер окна может намного превышать размер физического окна консоли, возвращаемый размер будет размером физического окна консоли. Будут возвращены два однобайтовых значения - первое будет текущим количеством строк (строк), а второе - количеством столбцов.

trans-unit.source: Whether or not changes made to an argument within a subroutine will be "visible" to the calling program depends on how the argument was passed. With its supported feature set (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), it provides significant programmer productivity capabilities.

While GnuCOBOL supports few of the OOP programming constructs defined by the COBOL2002 and COBOL20xx standards, it supports every aspect of the ANSI 85 standard and therefore fully meets the needs of points #1 and #2, above. With it’s supported feature set (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), it provides significant programmer productivity capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Хотя GnuCOBOL поддерживает несколько программных конструкций ООП, определенных стандартами COBOL2002 и COBOL20xx, он поддерживает все аспекты стандарта ANSI 85 и, следовательно, полностью отвечает требованиям пунктов №1 и №2 выше. Благодаря поддерживаемому набору функций (см. Итак, что такое GnuCOBOL? ), Он обеспечивает значительные возможности повышения производительности программистов.

Windows implementations of GnuCOBOL may, or may not, be similarly case sensitive with regard to copybook names, depending upon the Windows version and GnuCOBOL build options — it is safest to simply treat the COPY command as case-sensitive in all environments.

With a binary search, express the number of entries as a binary number (1,000 = 1111101000), count the number of digits in the result (which is, essentially, what a logarithm is, when rounded up to the next integer — the number of digits a decimal number would have if expressed in the logarithm’s number base). In this case, we end up with 10 — THAT is the worst-case number of tests required to find an entry or to identify that it doesn’t exist. That’s quite an improvement!

trans-unit.source: With its original limitation on the length of variable names (one- to six-character names comprised of a letter followed by up to five letters and/or digits), it’s implicit rule that variable were automatically created as real (floating-point) unless their name started with a letter in the range I-N, and its use of algebraic notation to express actions being taken, FORTRAN wasn’t a particularly readable language, even for programmers. Compare this with the equivalent COBOL code:
trans-unit.target: С его исходным ограничением на длину имен переменных (имена от одного до шести символов, состоящие из буквы, за которой следуют до пяти букв и / или цифр), это неявное правило, согласно которому переменные автоматически создавались как реальные (с плавающей точкой), если только их имя начиналось с буквы в диапазоне IN, а использование алгебраической нотации для обозначения предпринимаемых действий, FORTRAN не был особенно удобочитаемым языком даже для программистов. Сравните это с эквивалентным кодом COBOL:

With the above example, if the inspect subject were--ABCDEF----BCDEF-- the final result of the counting would be that C-ABC would be incremented by 1 while C-BCDE would be incremented only once; although the human eye clearly sees two "BCDE" sequences, theINSPECT ... TALLYINGwould only "see" the second — the first would have been processed by the first (higher-priority) counting instruction.
trans-unit.target: В приведенном выше примере, если бы объект проверки был --ABCDEF----BCDEF-- окончательный результат подсчета был бы таков, что C-ABC увеличился бы на 1, а C-BCDE увеличился бы только один раз; хотя человеческий глаз ясно видит две последовательности «BCDE», INSPECT ... TALLYING будет «видеть» только вторую - первая будет обработана первой (с более высоким приоритетом) инструкцией подсчета.

With this form My-01-Item can either be defined with the BASED attribute or be defined in LINKAGE SECTION. Instead of LENGTH OF My-01-Item you may also use a size smaller to the maximum field size as long as you ensure that the complete field is never used.

With this form, a block of storage equal in size to the defined size of My-01-Item (which must have been defined with the BASED attribute) will be allocated. The address of that block of storage will become the base address of My-01-Item so that it and its subordinate data items become usable within the program.

Адрес этого блока хранения станет базовым адресом My-01-Item, так что он и его подчиненные элементы данных станут доступными для использования в программе.

trans-unit.source: With this option, the program will wait for a pre-configured time for the lock to be released. If the lock is released within the preconfigured wait time, the read will be successful. If the pre-configured wait time expires before the lock is released, the read attempt will be aborted and a 51 file status will be issued.
trans-unit.target: С помощью этой опции программа будет ждать предварительно настроенного времени,пока замок не будет освобожден.Если замок будет освобожден в течение предварительно настроенного времени ожидания,чтение будет успешным.Если предварительно настроенное время ожидания истекает,прежде чем блокировка будет снята,попытка чтения будет прервана и будет выдан статус 51 файла.

trans-unit.source: You can force the GnuCOBOL runtime system to pre-load all dynamically-loaded modules that could ever be called by the program, at the time the program starts executing. This is accomplished through the use of the COB_PRE_LOAD run-time environment variable (see Run Time Environment Variables). If used, this will only pre-load those modules invoked via CALL literal-1, as the runtime contents of identifier-1 cannot be predicted.

trans-unit.source: form.
format

format of the READ statement that is available.
format of theREADstatement that is available.

format, respectively. The former allows for up to 16 digits of exact precision while the latter offers 34. The phrase “exact precision” is used because the traditional binary renderings of decimal real numbers in a floating-point format (FLOAT-LONG and FLOAT-SHORT, for example) only yield an approximation of the actual value because many decimal fractions cannot be precisely rendered in binary. The Decimal64 and Decimal128 renderings, however, render decimal real numbers in encoded decimal form in much the same way that PACKED-DECIMAL renders a decimal integer in digit-by-digit decimal form. The exact manner in which this rendering is performed is complex (Wikipedia has an excellent article on the subject — just search for

formats, respectively. These are binary encodings of real decimal numbers, and as such cannot represent every possible value between the minimum and maximum values in the range for those usages. Wikipedia has an excellent article on the Binary64 and Binary32 encoding schemes — just search on

of a COBOL statement (columns 1-6) has come to be used as a change indicator area. Programmers would place a code in columns 1-6 of every line they changed in a program. The author works in a COBOL shop where change indicators of the form “xxmmyy” are required on every altered line of a program — “xx” is the initials of the programmer while “mmyy” are the month and two-digit year of the date the change was made. This is frequently accompanied by a comment block at or near the top of a COBOL program providing general documentation of what changes were made and what change indicator was used to mark that change.
